text: This is a list of the rulers of the Kingdom of Asturias, which was a Kingdom in the Iberian peninsula. During the reign of Ordoño I the kingdom of Asturias progressively came to be known as the Kingdom of León. The kingdom was split in 910 and Fruela II received the Asturias. For later kings, see the list of Leonese monarchs and the list of Galician monarchs. From 1388, the title Prince of Asturias has been used for the heirs to the Castillian and Spanish thrones. ==List== {| style="text-align:center; " class="wikitable" ! Portrait ! Name ! Life ! Reign ! Capital of Asturias |- | 80px | Pelagius | c. 685 – 737 | 714 – 737 | rowspan=4|Cangas de Onís |- | 80px | Favila | died 739 | 737 – 739 |- | 80px | Alfonso I, the Catholic | c. 693 – 757 | 739 – 757 |- | 80px | Fruela I, the Cruel | c. 722 – 768 | 757 – 768 |- | 80px | Aurelius | c. 740 – 774 | 768 – 774 | San Martín |- | 80px | Silo | died 783 | 774 – 783 | rowspan=3|Pravia |- | 80px | Mauregatus, the Usurper | c. 719 – 789 | 783 – 789 |- | 80px | Bermudo I, the Deacon | c. 750 – 797 | 788 – 791 |- | 80px | Alfonso II, the Chaste | c. 760 – 842 | 791 – 842 | rowspan=5|Oviedo |- | 80px | Ramiro I | c. 790 – 850 | 842 – 850 |- | 80px | Ordoño I | 821 – 866 | 850 – 866 |- | 80px | Alfonso III, the Great | 852 – 910 | 866 – 910 |- | 80px | Fruela II, the Leprous | 875 – 925 | 910 – 924 |} ==Timeline== ImageSize = width:600 height:550 #Tamaño de la imagen: ancho, alto PlotArea = width:50 height:530 left:50 bottom:10 #Tamaño de la gráfica en sí dentro de la imagen: ancho, alto, margen izquierdo, margen derecho DateFormat = yyyy #Formato de fechas= y-cifra de año, m-cifra de mes, d-cifra de día. title: List of Asturian monarchs
